pullRequest.body:
This PR adds some API for lifting `AlgEquiv`s to the field of fractions.

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

</details>

`+ fieldEquivOfAlgEquivHom`

`+ fieldEquivOfAlgEquiv_algebraMap`

`+ fieldEquivOfAlgEquiv_trans`
`+ fieldEquivOfRingEquiv_algebraMap`

🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.

:v: tb65536 can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11620311129/job/32361815873)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11620311129/job/32361815287)

I think
```suggestion
lemma fieldEquivOfRingEquiv_algebraMap [Algebra B L] [IsFractionRing B L] (h : A ≃+* B)
```
is more in line with our naming conventions
In the absence of API, the alternative was to simply unfold the definitions until simp could take care of it. With the API, this is no longer necessary.

Can you add a comment explaining the relationship between this and `(fieldEquivOfAlgEquiv f).commutes` (ie, the rings involved), or maybe draw some commutative diagram if you think that is appropriat ehere?

```suggestion
/-- An algebra automorphism of a ring induces an algebra automorphism of its fraction field.

This is a bundled version of `fieldEquivOfAlgEquiv`. -/
@[simps]
```
Can you prove this and `map_mul` separately as `fieldEquivOfAlgEquiv_refl` and `fieldEquivOfAlgEquiv_trans`?

Rather than repeating the lemma, I think it makes sense to provide one that undoes a layer of bundling:
```suggestion
@[simp]
lemma fieldEquivOfAlgEquivHom_apply (f : B ≃ₐ[A] B) :
    fieldEquivOfAlgEquivHom K L f = fieldEquivOfAlgEquiv K L L f :=
  rfl
```

What would your thoughts be on changing this to something like
```suggestion
  [IsFractionRing A Af] [IsFractionRing B Bf] [IsFractionRing C Cf] [IsFractionRing D Df]
```
or
```suggestion
  [IsFractionRing A KA] [IsFractionRing B KB] [IsFractionRing C KC] [IsFractionRing D KD]
```
which makes it a bit easier to keep track of the 8 variables.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/Localization/FractionRing): Lifting `AlgEquiv`s to the field of fractions
